title: Lock “Yes” button position during evasive “No” interaction

requirements.summary: Keep the “Yes” button fixed at its exact pixel coordinates by preserving the original in-flow layout space when the “No” button switches to absolute positioning.
acceptanceCriteria: When the “No” button becomes evasive (absolute + translated), the “Yes” button does not shift position by even 1px in either X or Y compared to its initial position after first render.

The “Yes” button does not visually move due to layout reflow caused by the “No” button leaving the flex flow (i.e., the layout preserves the original spacing/alignment as if the “No” button were still in-flow).
Switching between non-evasive and evasive “No” button modes does not change the “Yes” button position.

file_operations.description: Adjust the question view button rendering so the original flex layout spacing remains identical before/after evasive mode: keep an in-flow “No” button-sized placeholder (e.g., the original No button element with visibility hidden / pointer-events none) when evasive mode is active, and render the evasive absolute-positioned “No” button separately on top. This prevents flex re-centering and locks the “Yes” button to its initial pixel coordinates while keeping the existing evasive movement and overlap-avoidance logic intact.

requirements.summary: Remove any hover/active transform animations from the “Yes” button so it never visually moves while remaining clickable and retaining current click behavior.
acceptanceCriteria: Hovering or pressing the “Yes” button does not apply scale/transform/transition effects that cause visible motion (no hover scale, no active scale).
Clicking the “Yes” button still triggers the existing click behavior (burst effect + accepted view transition).

file_operations.description: Update the “Yes” button Tailwind classes to remove transform-based interactions (e.g., remove hover:scale-* / active:scale-* and avoid transition-all if it could animate transforms). Keep non-motion visual affordances (color/shadow) as desired, and ensure the existing onClick behavior (HeartBurst + accepted transition) remains unchanged.
